byline.contributor: Richard Fausset contributed reporting from Atlanta, and Chris Dixon from Charleston, S.C.

abstract: South Carolina House of Representatives is expected to begin debate over proposal to remove Confederate battle flag from State House grounds; proposal has sparked outpouring of opinions both for and against, and at least two dozen amendments to bill are expected to be put forth by opponents.
lead_paragraph: The State Senate gave final approval to a measure forcing the controversial symbol from the grounds of the State House; the debate now heads to the House of Representatives.

headline.main: South Carolina Opponents of Confederate Flag Win One Round, but a Fight Still Looms
headline.print_headline: Opponents of Confederate Flag Win One Round, but a Fight Still Looms

snippet: The State Senate gave final approval to a measure forcing the controversial symbol from the grounds of the State House; the debate now heads to the House of Representatives.
